website_summaries.verdict: A remarkably inexpensive hammock tent for those seeking a reliable product at a cheaper price.
pros: Easily stores inside lightweight bag for camping trips and backpacking
Comes with 2 nylon ropes and 2 carabiners

customer_reviews.title: Horrible workmanship! Don’t waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.text: I slept wonderfully well in this hammock. However, forget about ever getting it back in the bag it came in. **Update- One of the main selling points for me was the hoops that held the bug netting up away from you. However, after using this the second time, the stiffening rods came completely out. Poor product design. *** 2nd UPDATE The company sent me a second hammock to replace the faulty one. I went camping this past weekend and was very thankful that I had brought another hammock for backup. See the pictures to see how this “new replacement “ hammock came out of the box. Don’t buy from this company!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but arrived broken. UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Fast response from seller with a new hammock which was in perfect condition. We love this hammock and its protection from our Pacific Northwest flying pests. Thanks changing my review to 5 stars! ORIGINAL REVIEW: While I love the idea of this hammock, it arrived with one of the 'hoops' broken. Even though technically it would still keep mosquitoes out, it would eventually poke through the netting where it is broken. Sadly we had to return it...and as it was a lightening deal I was not offered an exchange, just a refund. Next time it goes on sale I will try it again and then update my review.
customer_reviews.author: the inadvertent farmer

customer_reviews.title: Good hammock, cheaper than others like it with the ...
customer_reviews.text: Good hammock, cheaper than others like it with the same quality. The mosquito net is a nice touch and is way better for camping. My favorite feature is that the net doesn't need to be secured to stand up like most, could even really use it as a makeshift tent probably if you get a rainfly. The mosquito net is dark green and hammock part is whatever you chose. Definitely room for a couple smaller sized people or really comfortable for just 1. Haven't actually went camping with it to see if the mosquito net works yet, will update but overall I would say it's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The item arrived on time and it was in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.text: After receiving the hammock, I decided to try it out in my back yard and boy I liked it as i didn't have to deal with pesky bugs, making my self into buffet for the mosquitoes. I weight about 210 lbs and the hammock hold me nicely without feeling like it was gonna break on me. The rope that came with the unit is very nice quality material and the same rope is used on the hammock. Putting it back in the pouch was very easy also. It was nice taking a nap inside the mesh, the net is closed off with a zipper slider which zipped very smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L.

customer_reviews.title: Field test passed!
customer_reviews.text: Just picked this up last minute for a three day hike on the AT. It is super light weight, easy to set up an easy to put away quickly. It has no rain fly, so bring a tarp and some paracord or bungees if rain is a possibility. It's easy to make a simple tent covering. I read the reviews prior to purchasing the hammock. Some of the poor reviews cited the tendency of the mosquito net thread to break. My advice is to lay in the hammock like you are supposed to and it won't break. The net threading isn't meant to support weight. Great product! I am happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Pollyniak

customer_reviews.title: No bites!
customer_reviews.text: This is one neat addition to the camping surplus! This year has been horrible and on our third trip to sequoia I took this guy along after bringing the regular old uncovered cloth one. Not only was it able to sleep under the stars I was bite free! It came with all the hooks I needed to secure it to the tree as well as reinforcing rope and a nifty carrying bag. It packs away in my outfit just out of the way and I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Beachbum22Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Concept is great. Customer service is stellar!
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to receive these hammocks. I got one for myself and one for my husband. Very disappointed that the first time using the hammock, the netting ripped at the seam. Great concept and much less cumbersome than the usual nets. Hope my husband's lasts longer than mine did though. Update from 2 stars - after posting my review, I received a message from the seller asking if they could send me a replacement. I received the new one today and look forward to using it. So far, no issues with my husbands and he's used it a few times. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Joy Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Put it ON TOP OF your cot (or Kot!)
customer_reviews.text: I camp out of my Jeep or off my Harley a lot - I use a Go-Kot (best cot ever and lasts DECADES) and under a tarp hung off the Jeep or the motorcycle. I use this ON TOP of my Kot - it's perfect. It's easy enough to fold up, it pops up in seconds, it's held up, and it doesn't weigh much at all. Bug free sleep is a thing of beauty.
customer_reviews.author: solocanoe

customer_reviews.title: The idea was great, but didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.text: My kids were super excited about this one, however, since the bug net does not come all the way off they couldn't sit up in it when hanging around with friends. Also, my son said it was pretty hot inside like the screening was also blocking the breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Nickie Y

customer_reviews.title: Owned for 3 year now
customer_reviews.text: Great hammock for the price it was at. The plastic poles broke during the second year but haven't had it rip or break. Have used it on backpacking trips and just to relax in and never had an issue with it. So would recommend this product other than that the poles are not durable. Debating on replacing the poles with the ones used in shade covers for car windshields.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Jones

customer_reviews.title: I've liked using this hammock and wold give it a five ...
customer_reviews.text: I've liked using this hammock and wold give it a five star except that the way it packs into its carrying bag is awkward. Even when it arrived from the manufacturer, the metal "springs" in the netting (which hold it up away from the hammock to make the "tube"), stick oddly out from the bag. It's a lumpy mess which doesn't pack well or easily. My daughter chose to get a regular hammock without mosquito netting and suffered when we hiked and hung out a few weeks back. She got 8 mosquito bites and I got none. :( for her.
customer_reviews.author: notjameslewis

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It has been outside for over a month and my 5 year old can't kill it. He even went inverted on the screen a few times. The hardware is junk compared to the more expensive models but for the money this gets the job done and can hold up to the use and abuse of all summer long and kids.
customer_reviews.author: Lenka

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are super comfortable and convenient. Instructions on how to tie are easily to follow.
customer_reviews.author: menorcacollazo

customer_reviews.title: Mosquito net rips like tissue paper
customer_reviews.text: It was ok but the mosquito net broke with int 4 hours of hanging it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Worked out great used it for a month straight only thing I didn't like about it is it was very low profile if you lay it on the ground will you cannot even Set up you have to roll out of it. But a d'effernay's protected me from all of the creepy critters while I was sleeping in the wood line or a month
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M

customer_reviews.title: ... the price and ease of setup Id have to recommend these. Only needs two points to set up ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price and ease of setup Id have to recommend these. Only needs two points to set up the entire thing. The net didn't droop, the hammock stayed tight and worked out very well. Stitching next to the zipper is the weak point so make sure you are careful zipping and unzipping.
customer_reviews.author: KrAzE

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hammock and the price is right
customer_reviews.text: Nice Hammock and the price is right! I’ve only had it for about a week but I’ve used it quite a bit and I was surprised at how comfortable it is. I’m in south Florida and to be able to sleep outside without bugs eating you alive is pretty remarkable.
customer_reviews.author: Say No More....

customer_reviews.title: The Flaws
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok and handy tool to keep around while camping out, but I've ran into a few issues whilst using this product. One issue was the zipper. It seems the zipper has difficulties in properly closing while there is weight in the hammock. Another issue is that a hammock with a bug net only stops bugs from getting into your face. It doesn't stop them from biting through the hammock itself.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 3 for the family to go camping in the Adirondacks One had a rip by the netting. It was replaced quickly & I even returned it at Kohl’s. I love mine.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi D.

customer_reviews.title: So worth it
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS AMAZING I LOVE IT. Camping without itching and with all the natural air and light. Just make sure to put a blanket under you cause those buggers can poke through and get ur bum otherwise
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey H.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a keeper
customer_reviews.text: I used it when I went to Malaysia and stayed in a place that was very rural. Next I will be taking it to a Very desert climate where we might have to sleep on the ground. Have no doubt that it will definitely keep the bugs away. Definitely a keeper
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: keeps the bugs out
customer_reviews.text: Camped out at Lower Cedar Lake near Libby MT this summer. The bugs are thick there, this hammock made the whold trip worth while. Repacking was a hassle, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: Love it! / Recommended highly
customer_reviews.text: I love this hammock this 2 person hammock with a net is the ultimate relaxing way to experience a hom or just a relaxing weekend trip! Highly recommend this to anyone wanting to relax in their life!
customer_reviews.author: Logan Valverde

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable but was a bit weak and not as durable
customer_reviews.author: antonio

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, no more mosquito bites!
customer_reviews.text: Great hammock! My baby loves to swing in the hammock and now I don’t have to worry about mosquitoes! It’s really good quality and the netting gives you a lot of space without getting eaten alive! I have left my hammock outside for about a week now and we’ve used it every day! I recommend, especially if you like to camp out!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: make sure to clean it first.
customer_reviews.text: found a foreign beetle/assassin bug in the hammock still alive, not sure if anyone else had this issue, but got comfy kn the first use only to look up and see a fair sized insect was inside the hammock and had to spray the whole thing down with insecticide to kill it/any others stowed away in it..
customer_reviews.author: McKay

customer_reviews.title: My only complaint is that the snaps that hold the poles in place are not very sturdy and come unsnapped frequently
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this hammock. I can't imagine more than one person being in it at once though. My only complaint is that the snaps that hold the poles in place are not very sturdy and come unsnapped frequently. This leaves the mosquito netting hanging lower and closer to the person inside. It's inconvenient, but hasn't been a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I could find for the price. The bag it comes with is small so it is hard to fit the whole thing into. Material is not the most sturdy but it keeps bugs out. If you have the money for a really nice hammock with a bug net that would be a better choice. Also not very big if you are tall.
customer_reviews.author: Tait

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Worked great kept out all bug but very very thin
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Longevity of the net supporting poles questionable.
customer_reviews.text: I initial use was great. However last week we pulled it out and found both poles that support the netting broken. I’ll have to contact the manufacturer for replacements.
customer_reviews.author: ABP Photography

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Hammic
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this hammic at first due to th price. Having taken a chance n figuring if it was crap I'd give it to my kids (6 n 8) to play with (destroy). After testing it out I threw it right in my camping gear. The netting is great for keeping out even the smallest of bugs. Super easy to set up n pack up. In short I recommend this product n going to buy another for the kids to play with (destroy)....lol
customer_reviews.author: Chris Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good hammock for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great customer service. The hammock is good as well, just have to be a little careful with the netting in the edges.
customer_reviews.author: Le H Le

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected and very happy! Keeps the bugs out!
customer_reviews.text: We love this! We bought if for our daughter who is a bug magnet and she has been so happy! It's lightweight but well made and holds it shape well. Zippers are nice. Would buy again.!
customer_reviews.author: Stripes

customer_reviews.title: The ropes to put on the trees where to short ...
customer_reviews.text: The ropes to put on the trees where to short and the spring supports for the fly net were a problem getting in and out of the bag. I ended up taring it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for a while, but then I found the netting falling apart. I was disappointed with how long it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: PHILIP  W  WOOD

customer_reviews.title: Quality product!  A++ overall
customer_reviews.text: This thing delivers in many different ways, but I was able to use it last night for the first time and it was terrific. The netting is great for keeping gnats off, and fantastic to read in also. =^D
customer_reviews.author: Randall MatthessQ=

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This hammock was very easy to set up and put back into the bag (after a first failed attempt but easy to learn) and it sleeps like a dream! The sort of framed netting saves you a set up step that other hammocks require by simply popping up. No extra strings/rope required! Five stars for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the bugs out.
customer_reviews.text: Love my hammock. Compact and keeps the bugs out. I was worried it would rip easily but it's a great quality hammock at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Mika

customer_reviews.title: Very happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Does the job well. Tested it when I weighed 300lbs and had no issues. Arrived fast and works as advertised!!
customer_reviews.author: William Furtwangler

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: The masquito net part was great the hammock fabric is bery flimsy and seems like its not stitched the greatest hope it lasts more than on use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I like that two people are able to fit inside mosquitoes found there way to poke on the underside sprayed it with repellent and problem solved, dislike the folder part of it but who doesn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Yancy

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I love this hammock. High quality. Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: davenport

customer_reviews.title: Mosquito net not how it appears
customer_reviews.text: The mosquito net does not stay up like it appears to in the photos. It is right close to your face which makes it difficult to lay and read
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works well until you flip
customer_reviews.text: It works well until you flip over in it and then the net gets broken. The vendor reached out to me after the post and replaced it for free. Thanks IsYoung.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot Yendell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: i love this hammock! it's one of my favorites because it is just so convenient!
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Great bug free sleeping area
customer_reviews.text: Must have for backpacking trips. Great product for the price. It small, light, affordable, but may breakaway. When it does tear by the ends, you can wrap you feet to close the hole.
customer_reviews.author: Havesomefon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A very portable and compact hammock which I cannot wait to use.
customer_reviews.author: William Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Bug net shape
customer_reviews.text: The supports for the bug net do not have a good shape. The ends want to meet under the hammock. They did not poke causing discomfort, just minor annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Packs light, sets up easy, works, breaks down easy
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a bug-infested camping trip. Worked great! I’m 6’3” and had no issue with the length. I just set it up on the ground, put two stakes in either end, and avoided the bugs and spiders. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: WOrks perfect for your needs but is AWFUL to try and pack back up
customer_reviews.author: Josh Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Simple, strong, and safe. What else to expect from a hammock?
customer_reviews.author: Svyatoslav Pavlyk

customer_reviews.title: Looks good so far
customer_reviews.text: Looks good so far! I plan on just sliding a sleeping bag in it for when i'm sleeping under the stars. I sure hope that's some time soon!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 1 use
customer_reviews.text: Netting is to thin. Overall materiel is to thin. Bugs bite right thru
customer_reviews.author: J. Lino

customer_reviews.title: Perfect place to relax with no worries about insects!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for to relax and not have to dealing with insects.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: It's a strong material
customer_reviews.text: I loved it... I like the fact that is plastic so its water proof...
customer_reviews.author: marrero

customer_reviews.title: This hammock is AWESOME! It was so nice falling asleep at Havasupai ...
customer_reviews.text: This hammock is AWESOME! It was so nice falling asleep at Havasupai while looking up at the stars. The bug net made the biggest difference and made me feel protected. I'm so glad I decided to go hammocking instead of buying a tent. Absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and take down carry case is pefect size for repacking it.
customer_reviews.author: docnast

customer_reviews.title: Cozy but delicate.
customer_reviews.text: A pretty good hammock for the price. Nice and roomy. Would have given it more stars but the fabric is very flimsy. Every time i get into it, i feel like it's going to tear.
customer_reviews.author: Keoni

customer_reviews.title: Seems very durable
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product I have used it twice already I slept like a baby
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Pastors

customer_reviews.title: The only thing that I didn't like is that it caves in on you and if ...
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I wanted! The only thing that I didn't like is that it caves in on you and if two people were in it, they'd be all squished together in the middle- but that's most hammocks without a separator bar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bug net may rip beware
customer_reviews.text: Ripped the first time I used it but other then the rip it was great !
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: get the better version Zipper sucks netting looks wierd cone over the hammock
customer_reviews.text: Zipper sucks 3rd time using it an its already malfunctioning so disappointed 😥. What's the point of the net if the bugs are still In here with me.
customer_reviews.author: manuel irrrizarrry

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool hammock and it came in time.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Thigpen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift I purchased for a mosquito prone camper. The recipient is excited to try it.
customer_reviews.author: Kittie Love

customer_reviews.title: Served its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, only downfall was the pouch that contains the hammock separated at the seams.
customer_reviews.author: Gieseke_Fam

customer_reviews.title: Fits two but better if just one and fun to hang high in ...
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous! Fits two but better if just one and fun to hang high in the forest trees.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this hammock
customer_reviews.text: I love this hammock. With built in bug net makes it easy to set up when moto camping. Picture is with hammock quilt I purchased separately.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon C.

customer_reviews.title: Sex in a hammock is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I had sex in this hammock and it was awesome
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: This is by far the best hammock on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best hammock on Amazon . I sleep in mine every night and it is terrific.
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today and I love it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up comfortable for two would recommend to others. It was speedy delivery
customer_reviews.author: Roy Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Mine came with one of the fiberglass poles broken,
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with one of the fiberglass poles broken, and it is extremely hard to get back into the pouch that is attached to it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... than it should be to camp (screen tears very easily on twigs or fingernails)
customer_reviews.text: Less durable than it should be to camp (screen tears very easily on twigs or fingernails). But for $30 it's expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The netting is weak
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good hammock but just watch out for the netting I ripped mine with in 2 days
customer_reviews.author: JC Freitas

customer_reviews.title: ... but I have one myself and it has been great with heavy use the last two years on various ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son but I have one myself and it has been great with heavy use the last two years on various camping trips. No issues at all in that time.
customer_reviews.author: Manny Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Good hammock, easy to set up but i could ...
customer_reviews.text: Good hammock, easy to set up but i could really use a video showing how to put it back in the bag, its not as easy as the label shows.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Camping
customer_reviews.text: This does the trick! It's comfortable for one (not two like advertised, but two can fit). Keeps the mosquitoes out and fresh air circulating. Enjoyed this on our camping trip to Cibbets Flat. Lightweight and durable.
customer_reviews.author: David Lucero

product_meta.title: isYoung Hammock with Mosquito Net Parachute Fabric Hammock Net, Durable and Portable, Suit for 2 Persons, Tree Tent, Outdoors (Black/Army Green)
feature_bullets: isYoung camping hammock is fairly spacious and sturdy,114.2*57.1inches and 440.9Ibs weight limit.It is enough to support two average weight adults for a comfy sleeping place.
More durable and safer hammock net, 70D breathable parachute nylon fabric,soft to touch and good for health.
Mosquito-proof, sweet designed with tunnel-like mosquito net cover and smooth reversible zippers. Needle-like meshes and easily-close zippers, effectively prevent from mosquitoes.
Multifunctional and portable,works as hammock, tent, sleeping bag and swing.It can be folded into a small bag to carry, ideal for traveling, camping,beach and so on.
The hammock net come with two steel carabiners and two 118inches nylon ropes, steadier and safer.
